text.content: BAD WORDS
In the barrio, Miguel likes to talk with his friend
Andrés, but sometimes Miguel uses a bad_word.
When he says it, Andrés feels angry.
The teacher explains, “If you want respect, you must use good words.”
At recess, Miguel shouted a bad_word again, and Andrés told him to stop.
Miguel closed his mouth, but later he felt sad.
He remembered that when someone used a bad_word with him, he was also angry.
That night, his sister said, “A good word makes peace.”
The next day, Miguel promised to say only good things,
to talk kindly, and to show respect to every friend.
THE MEAN BOY
Yesterday at school, there was a boy named Julián who always was mean.
He pointed at kids and started to laugh when they were sad.
One girl dropped her notebook, and Julián made her cry.
She felt alone, but her friends came to help her.
The teacher asked, “Why was Julián so bad today?” Nobody answered.
Later, Julián sat in the corner with no friends.
He looked sad and wanted to cry too.
The teacher explained, “When you are mean, you end up alone.”
Julián realized that being bad is not power.
He decided to help instead of laugh, and the next day he tried to be a better friend at school.
THE LOUD FIGHT
On Saturday, two boys had a fight in front of the cancha.
They began to shout and push each other.
The noise was very loud, and many kids felt scared and wanted to run home.
One boy tried to hit, but the other shouted louder.
Nobody wanted to stop, and the crowd grew bigger.
Camila asked her brother for help, but he was also angry.
Finally, a neighbor said, “You must stop this now!”
The boys looked around and saw everyone shaking their heads.
They realized the fight was not about the ball, but about angry words.
There were no winners.
Later, they promised not to push, not to hit, and to stop before another fight.
A RUMOR AT SCHOOL
At our school, Camila heard a strange rumor.
The story was that her best friend copied answers in class.
Camila asked, “Is it true?”
Some students said yes, others said it was a lie.
One boy whispered that it was a secret, but he refused to talk more.
Camila felt hurt because she wanted to trust her friends.
Later, she asked Daniela, who was closed to the teacher, if the story was real.
Daniela said, “It is only a rumor, nothing true.”
Camila realized the person who made the lie did not think about the damage.
She explained to her friends that a rumor can hurt
but the truth makes friends stronger.
That day, she decided to keep no secret that could harm a friend.
FAKE FRIENDS
Andrés thought he had a friend, but that boy was a fake_friend.
They used to laugh together, but later Andrés heard a lie about him at school.
The story was not true, but many classmates stopped showing trust.
Andrés felt very sad and alone,
because nobody wanted to talk with him.
At lunch, a real friend came to listen.
She said, “If someone is a fake_friend,
If someone is real, they will stay.”
Andrés realized that fake bring only pain,
and real friends bring peace.
He told himself, “If I hear a lie,
I will not believe it until I see what is true.”
That afternoon, Andrés stopped feeling so alone,
because he knew who was real.
BULLYING IN SILENCE
In the barrio school, bullying happened often,
but students kept silence.
Laura felt pain when others laughed at her,
but she stayed alone and tried to hide it.
Her fear was strong, and she never wanted to speak.
One day, the teacher asked, “Why are you so quiet?” Laura said nothing...
Later, she told her cousin, “If I had a voice, I would speak about this.”
Her cousin reported what she said.
The teacher explained, “Someone told me you are suffering. Is it true?”
Laura finally admitted the fear she carried.
The teacher promised to help, saying,
“If nobody speaks, nothing will change.”
Laura realized that if she stayed alone, the bullying would continue.
But if she used her voice, things could change.
Now she tells others, “Never keep bullying in silence.
Always speak, always ask for help.”
